channel.title: attack.t1059.003 on My New Hugo Site
channel.description: Recent content in attack.t1059.003 on My New Hugo Site

item.title: File Was Not Allowed To Run
item.description: Detect run not allowed files. Applocker is a very useful tool, especially on servers where unprivileged users have access. For example terminal servers. You need configure applocker and log collect to receive these events.

item.title: Cmd.exe CommandLine Path Traversal
item.description: detects the usage of path traversal in cmd.exe indicating possible command/argument confusion/hijacking

item.title: Exploited CVE-2020-10189 Zoho ManageEngine
item.description: Detects the exploitation of Zoho ManageEngine Desktop Central Java Deserialization vulnerability reported as CVE-2020-10189

item.title: Koadic Execution
item.description: Detects command line parameters used by Koadic hack tool

item.title: AWS EC2 Startup Shell Script Change
item.description: Detects changes to the EC2 instance startup script. The shell script will be executed as root/SYSTEM every time the specific instances are booted up.

item.title: Exploiting SetupComplete.cmd CVE-2019-1378
item.description: Detects exploitation attempt of privilege escalation vulnerability via SetupComplete.cmd and PartnerSetupComplete.cmd described in CVE-2019-1378

item.title: Suspicious HWP Sub Processes
item.description: Detects suspicious Hangul Word Processor (Hanword) sub processes that could indicate an exploitation

item.title: Baby Shark Activity
item.description: Detects activity that could be related to Baby Shark malware

item.title: Command Line Execution with Suspicious URL and AppData Strings
item.description: Detects a suspicious command line execution that includes an URL and AppData string in the command line parameters as used by several droppers (js/vbs > powershell)

item.title: Elise Backdoor
item.description: Detects Elise backdoor acitivty as used by APT32

item.title: ZxShell Malware
item.description: Detects a ZxShell start by the called and well-known function name

item.title: CrackMapExec Command Execution
item.description: Detect various execution methods of the CrackMapExec pentesting framework

item.title: HTML Help Shell Spawn
item.description: Detects a suspicious child process of a Microsoft HTML Help system when executing compiled HTML files (.chm)

item.title: Powershell Execute Batch Script
item.description: Adversaries may abuse the Windows command shell for execution. The Windows command shell (cmd) is the primary command prompt on Windows systems. The Windows command prompt can be used to control almost any aspect of a system, with various permission levels required for different subsets of commands. Batch files (ex: .bat or .cmd) also provide the shell with a list of sequential commands to run, as well as normal scripting operations such as conditionals and loops. Common uses of batch files include long or repetitive tasks, or the need to run the same set of commands on multiple system

item.title: RedMimicry Winnti Playbook Execute
item.description: Detects actions caused by the RedMimicry Winnti playbook
